alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 7:25PM EST until December 23 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO 10 AM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to three inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph, with visibility less than a half mile at times. * WHERE...Extreme Western Allegany County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM Friday to 10 AM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM to 6 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Wind Chill Warning, the highest wind speeds will be Friday into Friday evening. Near blizzard conditions are possible. Affects from the extreme cold could be made worse due to power outages.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
